title.narrative: CHILD POVERTY AND PUBLIC FINANCE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: Disaggregated data and analytical evidence on monetary and multidimensional child poverty, and information on public social sector spending are available to inform advocacy and programming., which contributes to Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023 more vulnerable children benefit from social inclusion interventions guided by high-quality analysis on the policy environnment and public spending and strengthened by institutional support.

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
PF4C: Strengthened capacity of stakeholders in budgeting
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Child poverty, Public Finance and Local Governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Disaggregated data and analytical evidence on monetary and multidimensional child poverty, and information on public social sectorspending are available to inform advocacy and programming.

description.narrative: UNICEF support for public finance for children was intensified with the production of budget briefs,the ECDcost-benefit analysis and performance assessment of the education and health sectors, which paved the way for an open discussion and action plan with the Government for improved social sector budgeting. ;A public finance capacity-building action plan has been developed and implemented and a pool of public finance trainers set up to continue supporting the action plan. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/12/2021
